Articles.Content:
Scene Jumper

MechJeb2

ExtraPlanetaryLaunchpads

they all work fine Mechjeb still works with RasterPropMonitor
real fuels, deadly reentry, real solar system have been updated
realism overhaul v4 has been released

I would be updating this but the forum doesn't seem to want to let me. It's probably safe to say that most of the mods listed won't have 0.23.5 specific problems except for those already noted.

Parts mod should be OK except for those with incorrect connection node sizes.

For the record: Version 0.15 of RasterPropMonitor is explicitly compiled for 0.23.5 and supports some of the new features (though not all of them just yet). I'm pretty sure nothing is broken, at least.

The link to Simple Part Organizer is wrong. This is the correct one:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/62466-0-23-SimplePartOrganizer-v1-0

It was recompiled against 0.23.5 and fixed the one reported bug that kept it from interacting properly with someone else's antenna mod.

EDIT: BobCat's Soviet Pack does work, unless you dock something with soviet parts. I found that some parts do work with ARM parts, but it's not like I'm using them anyway. I have NovaPunch, KW, BobCat's stuff(well some of it), WorldSpace, Horizon Aeronautics, and FASA!

Edited April 13, 2014 by KyleofKerbin

Boat Parts R4 apparently is buggy in 0.23.5, so it's better to say it doesn't work (though R3 does apparently... Weird)

Skillful R1 work with 0.23.5, but will require an update for older users
KSP Interstellar was updated a few days ago, no major bugs have been found so far.

WorldSpace functions properly. I haven't had any issue with it yet!

EDIT: BobCat American Pack is OK. It is still a bit buggy, but it's alright. Same goes for someone's Japanese parts pack.

-Horizon Aeronautics works also. As far as I'm concerned, it is also practically bug-free.

Edited April 13, 2014 by KyleofKerbin

EDIT: Ignore. Posted to wrong thread.

Edited April 13, 2014 by HoustonDave
Connected Living Space and Soundtrack Editor are running on my 0.23.5 install with no problems.
There is a bug with the mod! The wheels from the parts pack aren't rolling -.- they are just jumping and getting dragged -.-

My mod - WernherChecker has been updated few days ago, so it should be fully compatibile with .23.5

Edited April 16, 2014 by Magion
kerbtown, kerbin city, and rasterprop monitor works fine
Infernal Robotics .14 is out and working fine

Infernal Robotics .14 is out and working fine

With the greatest respect there seem to several recent comments and also my own feeble attempts that 0.14 is still broken. Rotatrons not working, open hinges not working...

With the greatest respect there seem to several recent comments and also my own feeble attempts that 0.14 is still broken. Rotatrons not working, open hinges not working...

Correction and I am so sorry - entirely my mistake - reinstalling latest fixed it. Ignore my previous comment.

Bumping thread because it keeps coming top of my search results

KW has some odd issues. It all seems to work but any rocket I build with KW parts seems to take much longer for loading. This problem gets worse as the number of kw parts increases.

Hi,

Could you add Jebretary to the list? Thanks...

Thanks for adding jebretary. Your thread has simplified tracking new releases of my favorite mods. "Thanks for that"

Here is a new link I found if you want to add it to the list.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/79675-Klockheed-Martian-Asteroid-Cities-V0-1-Initial-release

@any moderator who read this: could it be possible to make this thread sticky (at least for some months) as it is very useful and become to be "buried" on the forum. Unless someone won't like the idea.

Thanks for making it sticky

sticky thanks :P

Remote tech has several community hotfixes for the .dll available here

You still need the parts though.
If you're still updating this - Near Future Propulsion (now Near Future Technologies) has had a proper .23.5 update for a while now

Is there any way to make all the resources from one particular mod work with another, or is that a completely fruitless endeavour? I'm trying to make all of the mods I've installed work in tandem but I want to know if that's even possible before I start possibly wasting my time...
